q: Who was the first President of India?
note: Dr. Rajendra Prasad served as the first President of India.

q: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
note: Mars is called the Red Planet because of iron oxide (rust) on its surface.

q: Who was the first woman Prime Minister of India?
note: Indira Gandhi served as the first and only woman Prime Minister of India from 1966 to 1977 and again from 1980 to 1984.

q: Which is the largest planet in our Solar System?
note: Jupiter is the largest planet, with a diameter of about 142,984 km â€” over 11 times that of Earth.

q: The 'Battle of Plassey' was fought in which year?
note: The Battle of Plassey (1757) marked the beginning of British rule in India under the East India Company.

q: Which river is known as the 'Sorrow of Bihar'?
note: The Kosi River is called the 'Sorrow of Bihar' due to frequent floods affecting the region.
Alexander Graham Bell was awarded the first US patent for the invention of the telephone in 1876.

q: Which country is known as the 'Land of the Rising Sun'?
note: Japan is called the 'Land of the Rising Sun' because it lies to the east of the Asian continent.

q: In which sport is the term 'LBW' used?
note: LBW stands for 'Leg Before Wicket' and is a rule used in the game of cricket.

q: Who wrote the National Anthem of India?
note: Rabindranath Tagore composed 'Jana Gana Mana', which was adopted as India's national anthem in 1950.

q: Which gas is most abundant in the Earth's atmosphere?
note: Nitrogen makes up about 78% of the Earth's atmosphere.

q: The United Nations was founded in which year?
note: The UN was established on 24 October 1945 after World War II to promote peace and cooperation.
